pullRequest.title: Create Jakarta faces-3.0 Feature
pullRequest.bodyText:
fixes #13888
fixes #13887
fixes #11835
Feature pulls in the MyFaces 3.0.0-RC1 API & IMPL.
I created new projects:

io.openliberty.org.apache.myfaces.3.0
io.openliberty.jakarta.jsf.3.0
io.openliberty.com.ibm.ws.jsf
io.openliberty.thirdparty.jsf-3.0
io.openliberty.internal.faces

And then transformed the remained of the projects needed for this feature.
Explaination of the io.openliberty.internal.faces:
We have two components when building the implementation jar: io.openliberty.org.apache.myfaces.3.0 and com.ibm.ws.jsf.shared. The myfaces.3.0 depends on the shared jar (through the build path).  However, when I build the myfaces.3.0 component, I encounter a complication error because of
  class file for javax.faces.application.Application not found
libertyGit/open-liberty/dev/io.openliberty.org.apache.myfaces.3.0/src/com/ibm/ws/jsf/extprocessor/JSFExtensionFactory.java:370: error: incompatible types: jakarta.faces.application.Application cannot be converted to javax.faces.application.Application
                    cdiInitializer.initializeCDIJSFViewHandler(application);

To avoid this, I created my own io.openliberty.jsf.shared jar (swapping javax with jakarta) . However, I then ran into an issue of a method implementing a webcontainer method from an abstract class (when building the new shared jar). Again, this is due to the javax/jakarta ServletRequest & ServletResponse types.
libertyGit/openliberty/dev/io.openliberty.jsf.shared/src/com/ibm/ws/jsf/shared/extprocessor/JSFExtensionProcessor.java:20: error:
JSFExtensionProcessor is not abstract and does not override abstract method handleRequest(ServletRequest,ServletResponse) in RequestProcessor
public class JSFExtensionProcessor extends WebExtensionProcessor {

If there’s a way to use the transformed jakarta jars on the build path, I think that should address my problems. However, I’m not aware of a way to do that.
My implemented solution instead was to

Transform the the shared jar.
Extract the javax com.ibm.ws.jsf.* classes and place them into the io.openliberty.com.ibm.ws.jsf project and then transform it.


io.openliberty.internal.faces exports those com.ibm.ws.jsf* classes
The OSGI-INF service component files as moved to this new project.
I left the JSFGlobalTagLibConfig class within the io.openliberty.org.apache.myfaces.3.0  project because the META-INF/myfaces_core.tld is stored within the Myfaces 3.0 Bundle META-INF folder.


Update the io.openliberty.org.apache.myfaces.3.0 buildpath


io.openliberty.org.apache.myfaces.3.0 imports the classes above. They are imported dynamically because the project doesn't use them directly (only during class lookups)

nodes.bodyText: You updated the other copyright dates since we moved this existing class to a new bundle but didn't update it here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,15 @@

nodes.bodyText: definely do not create new features as ga ... always start with noship
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jsf.beanValidation-2.3
+IBM-App-ForceRestart: install, \
+ uninstall
+IBM-Provision-Capability: osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jsf-2.3))", \
+ osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.beanValidation-2.0))"
+IBM-Install-Policy: when-satisfied
+-bundles=com.ibm.ws.jsf.beanvalidation
+kind=ga

nodes.bodyText: should this be io.openliberty.faces.internal?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,128 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-SymbolicName: io.openliberty.org.apache.myfaces.3.0
+
+-fixupmessages.missingexport: "Used bundle version * for exported package";is:=ignore
+
+instrument.ffdc: false
+instrument.classesExcludes: \
+  org/**/*.class
+
+
+Service-Component: \
+  com.ibm.ws.faces_3_0.taglib; \
+    implementation:=com.ibm.ws.faces.taglibconfig.FacesGlobalTagLibConfig; \
+    provide:='com.ibm.wsspi.jsp.taglib.config.GlobalTagLibConfig'; \
+    properties:="service.vendor=IBM", \
+
+Include-Resource: \
+  @${repo;org.apache.myfaces.core.impl;3.0.0.RC1;EXACT}!/META-INF/**, \
+  @${repo;io.openliberty.jakarta.faces.3.0}!/META-INF/resources/**, \
+  @${repo;io.openliberty.jakarta.faces.3.0}!/META-INF/internal-resources/**, \
+  META-INF=@src/META-INF
+
+DynamicImport-Package: \
+  com.ibm.ws.jsf.cdi, \
+  com.ibm.ws.jsf.config.annotion,\
+  com.ibm.ws.jsf.config.resource,\
+  com.ibm.ws.jsf.ee, \
+  com.ibm.ws.jsf.spi.impl, \
+  com.ibm.ws.jsf.extprocessor
+
+
+# Don't export the org.apache.myfaces.buildtools package as that is only needed for compilation.  The jar that contains the
+# org.apache.myfaces.buildtools package is myfaces-builder-annotations-1.0.9.jar
+# Additionally, a subset of these org.apache.myfaces packages are exported by the thirdparty.faces-3.0 bundle - so we exclude them here.
+Export-Package: \
+  !org.apache.myfaces.buildtools.*, \
+  !org.apache.myfaces.renderkit.html, \
+  !org.apache.myfaces.shared.config, \
+  !org.apache.myfaces.shared.renderkit, \
+  !org.apache.myfaces.shared.renderkit.html, \
+  !org.apache.myfaces.shared.renderkit.html.util, \
+  com.ibm.ws.faces.taglibconfig, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.application;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.application.viewstate;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.cdi.model;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.cdi.view;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.cdi.util;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.component;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.component.search;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.component.visit;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.context;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.context.servlet;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.config.annotation;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.config.impl.digester.elements;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.flow;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.flow.cdi;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.lifecycle;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.push.cdi;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.renderkit;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.shared.context.flash;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.shared.taglib;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.shared.taglib.core;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.shared.util;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.spi.impl;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.taglib.core;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.taglib.html;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.compiler;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.component;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.el;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.impl;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.pool;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.pool.impl;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.tag;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.tag.composite;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.tag.jsf;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.tag.jsf.core;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.tag.jsf.html;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.tag.jstl.core;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.tag.jstl.fn;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.tag.ui;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.util;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.webapp;thread-context=true;version=3.0.0, \
+  org.apache.myfaces.*;version=3.0.0
+
+# Import everything we need except for the below exclusions that will not be needed at runtime.
+Import-Package: \
+  !com.ibm.ws.jsf.ee, \
+  !com.google.inject, \
+  !jakarta.ejb, \
+  !jakarta.persistence, \
+  !org.apache.tomcat, \
+  *
+
+-buildpath: \
+  org.apache.myfaces.core:myfaces-impl;version=3.0.0,\
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.faces.3.0;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.classloading;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.webcontainer;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.serialization;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.container.service;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.adaptable.module;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.anno;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.managedobject;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.jsp;version=latest,\
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.el.4.0;version=latest,\
+	io.openliberty.jakarta.servlet.5.0;version=latest, \
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.cdi.3.0;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.logging.core,\
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.spi.kernel.service,\
+  com.ibm.websphere.org.osgi.core;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.websphere.org.osgi.service.component;version=latest,\
+  com.ibm.ws.org.osgi.annotation.versioning;version=latest,\
+  org.apache.myfaces.buildtools:myfaces-builder-annotations;version=1.0.9
+  io.openliberty.com.ibm.ws.jsf;version=latest

nodes.bodyText: It would be nice to define an implementation version variable here for the export version so when we upgrade to the newer version we only have to change it in one spot.

nodes.bodyText: If we're skipping this b/c it does not work lets get an issue opened for investigation.
If we're skipping this b/c it does not work lets get an issue opened for investigation so we don't forget about it.
Same comment we need to open an issue for investigation
Was this added b/c we we're pulling in the 3.0.0 version without it and the test was failing?

+jakartaeeMe: true
+
+app-resources= \
+  META-INF/services/org.apache.myfaces.config.annotation.LifecycleProviderFactory | \
+  META-INF/services/org.apache.myfaces.config.annotation.LifecycleProvider | \
+  META-INF/services/org.apache.myfaces.spi.AnnotationProvider | \

+Include-Resource: \

+Service-Component: \

+    provide:='com.ibm.wsspi.webcontainer.collaborator.WebAppInjectionClassListCollaborator'; \
+    immediate:=true; \
+    properties:="service.vendor=IBM", \
+  com.ibm.ws.org.apache.myfaces_3_0_${replace;${bVersion};\\.;_}.ResourceProvider; \
+    implementation:=com.ibm.wsspi.classloading.ResourceProvider; \
+    provide:=com.ibm.wsspi.classloading.ResourceProvider; \
+    configuration-policy:=ignore; \
+    properties:="resources=${app-resources}", \

+    implementation:=com.ibm.ws.javaee.version.FacesVersion; \
+    provide:=com.ibm.ws.javaee.version.FacesVersion; \
+    properties:="version:Integer=30"

nodes.bodyText: Given that this is a renamed feature io.openliberty and uses faces instead of jsf we need to make sure this and the other jsf provider features can't be loaded at the same time.  Have we done any testing? Perhaps a discussion in the jakarta channel is necessary as there are likely other providers that have hit the same issue. For example I fear we would be able to load the jsfContainer-2.3 feature and the faces-3.0 feature at the same time.
